gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Contour.Contours
Class UniformContours

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Contour.Contours.Contours
      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Panels.Contour.Contours.UniformContours
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPreserveState
public class UniformContours
extends Contours

Represents a set of uniformly spaced contour levels.

Field Detail

MIN_VALUE_KEY

public static final java.lang.String MIN_VALUE_KEY
"Minimum value" - This static constant String is a key for referencing the height of the lowest contour level in this collection of contour levels. The value that this key references is a Float.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DELTA_KEY

public static final java.lang.String DELTA_KEY
"Delta value" - This static constant String is a key for referencing the distance between successive contour levels in this collection of uniformly spaced contour levels. The value that this key references is a Float.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_MIN_VALUE

public static final float DEFAULT_MIN_VALUE
The default height of the lowest contour level in this collection of uniformly spaced contour levels. The value of this field is 0f.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DEFAULT_DELTA

public static final float DEFAULT_DELTA
The default distance between successive contour levels in this collection of uniformly spaced contour levels. The value of this field is 1f.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

UniformContours

public UniformContours()
Creates a default set of uniformly spaced contour levels.

UniformContours

public UniformContours(float minValue,
                       int numLevels,
                       float delta)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Create a set of contour levels where the lowest contour level has an "elevation" of minValue, the distance between successive contour levels is delta, and there are numLevels contour levels in the collections of contour levels.

Parameters:
minValue - The "elevation" of the lowest contour level.
numLevels - The number of contour levels in this collection of contour levels.
delta - The distance between successive contour levels.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If numLevels is less than 2 or if Contours.Contours(int) throws an IllegalArgumentException.

UniformContours

public UniformContours(float minValue,
                       float maxValue,
                       int numLevels)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Create a set of contours levels where the lowest contour level has an "elevation" of minValue, the highest contour level has an "elevation" of maxValue, and there are a total of numLevels contour levels.

Parameters:
minValue - The "elevation" of the lowest contour level.
maxValue - The "elevation" of the hightest contour level.
numLevels - The number of contour levels in the set. Note: To calculate the contour levels, there needs to be at least 2 contour levels.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If minValue>maxValue or numLevels<2.
Method Detail

getObjectState

public ObjectState getObjectState(boolean isDefault)
Used to get the state information for this collection of uniformly spaced contour levels. This method is overriden to include in the state the height of the lowest contour level and the distance between successive contour levels.

Specified by:
getObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Overrides:
getObjectState in class Contours
Parameters:
isDefault - If true, the default state for this collection of contour levels is returned. If false, the current state is returned.
Returns:
The state of this collection of uniformly spaced contour levels.
See Also:
Contours.getObjectState(boolean)

setObjectState

public void setObjectState(ObjectState state)
Used to set the state information for this collection of uniformly spaced contour levels. This method is overriden to allow storing in the state the height of the lowest contour level and the distance between successive contour levels.

Specified by:
setObjectState in interface IPreserveState
Overrides:
setObjectState in class Contours
Parameters:
state - An encapsulation of the state information for this collection of uniformly spaced contour levels.
See Also:

getLevelAt in class Contours

isLevelCovered

public boolean isLevelCovered(float value)
Used to determine if the given "elevation" is represented as a contour level in this set.

Parameters:
value - The "elevation" of the contour level in question.
Returns:
True if at least one of the contour levels in this set has an "elevation" of value and false otherwise.

getDelta

public static float getDelta(float minValue,
                             float maxValue,
                             int numLevels)
Given a collection of uniformly spaced contour levels with the height of the highest and lowest contour level and the number of contour levels given, this method determines the distance between each successive contour level.

Parameters:
minValue - The height of the lowest contour level in this collection of contour levels.
maxValue - The height of the highest contour level in this collection of contour levels.
numLevels - The number of contour levels in the collection of contour levels.
Returns:
The distance between each contour level in this collection of uniformly spaced contour levels.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Testbed. Used to test if the methods for determining the number of levels and highest and lowest contour level work as they should.

Parameters:
args - Unused.
